data.title: Fun Drinks
data.text: I have been there a couple of times. The staff is friendly and serve great drinks. The food is good too. I recommend going to their Tuesday happy hour. This does help to offset the cost.

data.title: Packed with character
data.text: I heard about this place via the owner's blog, stopped in Springfield for the night while driving from WA to MS. Worth it. The craft cocktails are expertly mixed with quirky flavors and fun presentation, the food is great, and the atmosphere is the best. Loved it.

data.title: Would not recommend
data.text: I was excited to try this new venue,  liked the name, intrigued with the concept. Totally disappointed! Food is overpriced and not presented in an appealing manner. The noise level is beyond loud. The service was very poor. WON'T be going back.

data.title: Tons of Rum and Soda from Different Islands
data.text:
This place is not somewhere I want to go again on a Friday because it was really crowded and the service was really slow, but I understand because it was a weekend night at a downtown bar. 

They have a really awesome selection of rum and sodas from several islands in the Caribbean and beyond. It is worth checking out, unless you're not a drinker. If that is the case then I can't help you because I didn't eat there. 

*I gave them "very good" under food, though I am using that to gauge the only thing I had, which is their selection of rum.

data.title: Cool lunch spot on the Square
data.text:
We were back home visiting Springfield after a long absence and had read about this new place opening. Our family lives down by the Battlefield Mall, so we rarely ever went to the Square, but what a neat transformation! This restaurant appears to be a slice of what the area is becoming - open, bright and fresh.

This is a re-imagined Tiki bar with classic drinks and new inventions. The GG Itch was quite tasty and not too strong for lunch. Fun drink names and glasses they're served in. Service was fast and quite friendly.

The Elotes was not the typical "street corn". This was the roasted corn off the cob, served in a skillet and topped with cotija, but the seasoning was too spicy and reminiscent of taco seasoning (let the corn speak for itself). The tortillas just disintegrated and couldn't hold the corn. Unfortunately, this just didn't work.

The GG Cuban and Garden Party sandwiches were fabulous, though! The Cuban had very moist and tender pork shoulder (as well as the ubiquitous pork belly) and the house made mustard and pickled pineapple beautifully complemented these. My sister inhaled her sandwich and proclaimed it delicious.

Springfield - you have a new hit on your hands!
